subject: Re: [junit] Converting Oracle's dialect of SQL to HSQLDB?
msgSnippet: ... You could take a look on the Hibernate project. If you can define the mappings for Hibernate, you can use hibernate to create your HSQLDB and/or Oracle
messageBody:
John Lindwall wrote:

> I'm becoming curious about HSQLDB (and other in-memory databases).
> Our growing body of DBUnit-based tests are taking longer and longer to
> run and I feel it's hurting quality.

You could take a look on the Hibernate project. If you can define the
mappings for Hibernate, you can use hibernate to create your HSQLDB
and/or Oracle database. You can still use your current jdbc data access
if you wish. Personally and professionaly I use hibernate exclusively
for my persistence.

Martijn


>
> Cavaet: I am not a database/SQL expert
>
> I installed hsqldb and tried to run our DDL file that creates our
> unit-test database against it. We use Oracle for test/production
> now. The DDL is riddled with Oracle-specific cruft: NUMBER instead of
> INTEGER, VARCHAR2 vs VARCHAR, etc.
>
> Is there an easy way to take a DDL file like this and convert it into
> a format that HSQLDB will grok? We currently use TOAD to generate the
> DDL file BTW if that matters.
>
> THanks!
>
